meanings.definition: To shout "hurrah" in celebration or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The children were hurrahing when they won the game.
meanings.sent2: The crowd was hurrahing for their favorite team at the match.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started hurrahing along with the cheering fans.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside sounded like nature hurrahing in triumph.
meanings.sent5: The students were hurrahing with joy as they received their diplomas.

meanings.definition: The act of cheering or expressing joy by shouting "hurrah".
meanings.sent1: The hurrahing of the fans echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent2: The hurrahing of the crowd could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The hurrahing of the children at the party was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The hurrahing of the audience filled the theater with energy.
meanings.sent5: The hurrahing of the team filled the locker room with excitement.

meanings.definition: The sound of people cheering or shouting "hurrah".
meanings.sent1: The hurrahing of the supporters was music to the team's ears.
meanings.sent2: The hurrahing of the fans created a festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The hurrahing of the crowd blended with the music at the concert.
meanings.sent4: The hurrahing of the audience drowned out the noise of the city.
meanings.sent5: The hurrahing of the children filled the playground with happiness.
